pr_title: Implement client side cache evictor and metastore

timeline.bodyText: Is this implementation actually exactly the same as the HashSetMetaStore in the test? If so maybe we only need 1 of these?
timeline.author: calvinjia

replies.bodyText: looks like so. Then we should dedup and keep one impl DefaultMetaStore.
replies.author: apc999

replies.bodyText: We can reuse the DefaultMetaStore in tests for now, but it is likely we will have to reintroduce the test implementation as the DefaultMetaStore become more complex.
replies.author: bf8086

replies.bodyText: if that's the case we can keep them separate.
replies.author: calvinjia

timeline.bodyText: is this class thread safe? If yes, please annotate it with @ThreadSafe; if not, currently LocalCacheManager does not provide any guard to protect concurrent access to this evictor from multiple threads.
timeline.author: apc999
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,51 @@

+package alluxio.client.file.cache;
+
+import java.util.Collections;
+import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
+import java.util.Map;
+
+/**
+ * LRU client-side cache eviction policy.
+ */
+public class LRUCacheEvictor implements CacheEvictor {

timeline.bodyText: I would suggest to add user-facing propertyKey like alluxio.user.client.cache.evictor and allow to select different evictors (thought currently we have only one). This will make it easier to switch cache replacement policy without recompiling the src code
timeline.author: apc999

timeline.bodyText:
Shall we cover the following cases:

evict before any other operations (just make sure we don't see NPE)
evict after all pages are put and then deleted
timeline.author: apc999

timeline.bodyText: I think you want null instead of empty arrays?
timeline.author: calvinjia

timeline.bodyText: can you mark this method and the interface def with @Nullable
timeline.author: apc999
